hero.title: Indigenous people in Philippines’s north ‘ready to fight’ as tensions rise
hero.description: The remote island of Itbayat is in the eye of any conflict with China and its residents are preparing themselves.

primary.lead: Gentleman's Agreement Between Duterte and China
primary.title: China insists ‘gentleman’s agreement’ under Duterte administration
primary.description: Manila, Philippines — China on Thursday insisted on the existence of a “gentleman’s agreement” made during former president Rodrigo Duterte’s tenure.

secondary.title: A not so gentlemen’s agreement
secondary.description: For the past several weeks, Beijing has making hay over the supposed “official commitment” of the Philippine government to tow BRP Sierra Madre out of the Ayungin Shoal.

secondary.title: Duterte admits deal with Xi on West Philippine Sea status quo
secondary.description: Former President Rodrigo Duterte on Thursday admitted that he had agreed with Chinese President Xi Jinping to maintain the status quo in the West Philippine Sea.

secondary.title: <abbr title="Former President Rodrigo R. Duterte">FPRRD</abbr> denies ‘gentleman’s agreement’ with China on West Philippine Sea
secondary.description: Davao City – Former President Rodrigo R. Duterte has broken his silence and denied making any deal with China over the West Philippine Sea (WPS).

carousel.title: Fighting for their land: on Philippine’s Boracay, Ati tribe faces eviction
carousel.description: Boracay’s indigenous Ati people have been pushed to the margins and are fighting to retain agricultural land that developers claim is better used for tourism.

carousel.title: The Fried Chicken Is in New York. The Cashier Is in the Philippines.
carousel.description: A few New York City restaurants are experimenting with virtual staff members, who greet customers onscreen via Zoom from the Philippines.

carousel.title: PH unemployment rate down to 3.5%
carousel.description: The Philippines’ unemployment rate recorded a slight decrease to 3.5 percent in February 2024 from 4.8 percent in the same month last year, according to the latest report of the Philippine Statistics Authority

carousel.title: <abbr title="Department of Health">DOH</abbr> reminds public to get kids vaccinated as pertussis cases climb
carousel.description: Health authorities say the Philippines still has enough stock of pentavalent vaccines effective against pertussis, with some 6 million doses expected to arrive by July
